title-group.article-title: Adaptive robust stabilization of a class of uncertain non-linear systems with mismatched time-varying parameters

contrib-group.aff: Electrical Engineering Department, Iran University of Science and Technology, Tehran, Iran

abstract.p: In this paper, an adaptive robust stabilization algorithm is presented for a class of non-linear systems with mismatched uncertainties. In this regard, a new controller based on the Lyapunov theory is proposed in order to overcome the problem of stabilizing non-linear time-varying systems with mismatched uncertainties. This method is such that the stability of the closed-loop system is guaranteed in the absence of the triangularity assumption. The proposed approach leads to asymptotic convergence of the states of the closed-loop system to zero for unknown but bounded uncertainties. Subsequently, this method is modified so that all the signals in the closed-loop system are uniformly ultimately bounded. Eventually, numerical simulations support the effectiveness of the given algorithm.

sec.title: 1 Introduction
sec.p: For uncertain systems, the problem is to design a controller that uses dynamic equations to govern the trajectory of the system with acceptable performance. Robust control of uncertain non-linear systems is one of the most significant issues in both theoretical and practical aspects of control systems, having attracted a lot of attention during the last three decades. Consequently, different methods relevant to stabilization of non-linear dynamical systems with significant uncertainties have been presented [1–4].

There are two main restrictions related to uncertainties. The first difficulty is that numerous methods are constructed based on the so-called matching condition [1, 5–10]. To overcome this limitation, some methodologies for the control of uncertain non-linear dynamical systems without matching condition have been introduced [4, 11–14]. The second problem is the triangularity assumption, which is less restrictive than the matching condition [1]. The design procedure with the triangularity condition affords the possibility of applying the designed controller to a wider range of uncertainties; however, this condition is also restrictive in many practical applications [4].

Feedback linearization is an effective and well-known method for controlling non-linear systems [1, 3, 15, 16]. The basic idea is to find a non-linear coordinate transformation such that the ultimate closed-loop system is linear. In fact, the control law is designed in such a way that any non-linear dynamic effect in the system is compensated. Since precise determination of the system parameters is a key problem, robustifying this method is a necessity for experimental implementation. Indeed, based on the explanations given above, robust and adaptive robust feedback linearization has been introduced [1, 4]. For example, in reference [1], robust and adaptive robust controllers are designed for feedback linearizable systems considering the triangularity assumption of uncertainties. The authors of reference [1] assume that the uncertain parameters are constant or the upper bound of these parameters is known. Furthermore, in reference [4] and the references therein, robust and adaptive robust control of uncertain non-linear systems based on input/output linearization have been introduced.

The main drawback of the aforementioned papers is that the matching or the triangularity assumption is a certain necessity. In order to eliminate the triangularity assumption, some new methods have been proposed for mismatched uncertainties [17–20]. These methods are commonly designed based on integral sliding mode control. The basic idea is to decompose the uncertainty into two parts; the controller is first designed as if there is no mismatched uncertainty. Then stability analysis is carried out as the mismatched uncertainty is reintroduced; this means that as long as the mismatched uncertainty is sufficiently small, the system will remain uniformly ultimately bounded [4]. The asymptotic stability of a class of linear system with matched and mismatched uncertainties is also presented in reference [21]. In these approaches, it is required that the information about the bound of uncertainties be known a priori.

The principal outcome of this work is that stabilization of a class of uncertain non-linear systems proposed in reference [1] can be solved without the triangularity assumption. In this paper, a simple adaptive robust controller is designed for a class of non-linear system with mismatched time-varying uncertainty in the absence of the triangularity assumption so that no information about the bounds of uncertainties is required. The method is based on Lyapunov theory, and it is shown that the asymptotic convergence of the closed-loop system to zero is achieved while maintaining bounded states at the same time. To overcome the chattering phenomenon, some modifications are performed on the control signal so that the states of the closed-loop system are uniformly ultimately bounded (UUB). The main contributions of this work can be summarized as follows.

list-item.p: This paper successfully applies an adaptive robust technique to feedback linearizable systems with linearly parameterized mismatched uncertainties.
The controller presented in this paper is such that the assumption of system triangularity condition is not required. Moreover, this approach does not require any bounds of time-varying parameters.
In the controller design, the adaptation parameter is scalar, leading to a decrease in computational burden.

sec.p: This paper is organized as follows. The problem formulation of adaptive robust stabilization of uncertain feedback linearizable systems will be presented in section 2. In addition, stability analysis of the algorithm is included in this section. To demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm, numerical simulations have been illustrated in section 3. Finally, the conclusions are given in section 4.

sec.title: 4 Conclusion
sec.p: In this paper, an adaptive robust stabilization algorithm for a class of uncertain non-linear system using only scalar input is presented, and it is assumed that the uncertain parameters are bounded and time-varying. This method is based on the Lyapunov stability theorem, taking into account that the uncertain parameters can be mismatched. In the presence of uncertainties, all the signals in the closed-loop system are UUB; in addition, the proposed method is such that the mere knowledge of the boundedness of the parameters is sufficient. Simulation results reveal the effectiveness of the proposed algorithm in the stabilization of a non-linear system with mismatched time-varying parameters.
